Class Mesh.Vertice

java.lang.Object
  Mesh.Vertice
Enclosing class:
Mesh
public class Mesh.Vertice
extends java.lang.Object

A single vertice on a Mesh.

REMARK: I made Vertice an innerclass of Mesh because:

  1. A Vertice can't exist without a Mesh.
  2. A Vertice can now behave as a normal object to the outside but it's implementation remains a set of efficient operations on the same matrix.

Author:
Karsten Daemen

          Returns the coordinates of this vertice in a 3x1 vector.

Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

Method Detail

asVector

public org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F asVector()

Returns the coordinates of this vertice in a 3x1 vector.

  • The element in the first row is the x coordinate.
  • The element in the second row is the y coordinate
  • The element in the third row is the z coordinate

asVectorIn

public org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F asVectorIn(org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F matrix,
                                               int startRow,
                                               int startCol)

Writes the coordinates of this vertice as a 3x1 vector in matrix starting from the position (startRow, startCol).

  • The element in (startRow, startCol) is the x coordinate.
  • The element in (startRow+1, startCol) is the y coordinate
  • The element in (startRow+2, startCol) is the z coordinate

ATTENTION: Make sure that (startRow+2, startCol) still fits in matrix, if not this method will behave unexpectedly.
